column4: what is the best method to back up my home directory (11GB) to another box? then rebuild the box and restore my home directory back from the other box?
i like rdiff-backup
it allows you to make incremental backups easily, so backing up a 11gb partition can take 1 minute if only 5 megs have changed
i was planning to do this once; backup, rebuild, restore
it will still work, but it's always a very good idea to backup regularly (read: daily)
if you were just doing it once, scp -a should work too...but i prefer rdiff-backup regardless.
i know, i know ... it is a good practice to backup daily :)
or nc (netcat)
hrmmm...something tells me that's not what you want.  but i've never heard of netcat.  also see: rsync (what rdiff-backup uses)
ha. i used it once (nc). it took forever over a local network.
i was looking for an easiest, fastest method to backup /home dir
sudo rdiff-backup /home myuser@remotemachine.com::/my/backup/dir
you need rdiff-backup on both machines, of course
ok. will try that way. thanks. :)
